newsitem.title: USA: San Francisco library chief resigns.
newsitem.headline: San Francisco library chief resigns.

text.p: San Francisco's chief librarian resigned as expected on Tuesday following allegations the system was mismanaged financially.
Chief Librarian Kenneth Dowlin made the announcement at a special meeting of the library's finance committee. "I wish you goodbye, good luck and God bless," Dowlin said.
The library system faces a $1.2 million budget deficit, which Dowlin had proposed to eliminate through staff cuts.
In recent weeks, the system's financial troubles have drawn fire from Mayor Willie Brown and other San Francisco officials.
